column5: The accomodations are very nice.Great mattresses hot water and electricity.   This really is a wonderful Lake.Much more cool structure that a guy could fish in many many years.Despite the poor moon phase we did very well.3 inch gulp minnows ,crawlers and frozen shiners all produced well.The boats were were well maintained and gassed by 7 a.m. each day I look forward to my return. That Pike came off Wolf Island by the way Connie. Kevin does indeed live to fish.and happy to share his info.This is a very reasonable trip into an exciting lake and I would recommend a visit to anyonewho has comtemplated it.
nice pics those are some big fish
Well done Camp Chef  Thanks for taking the time to post these pics.  Some dandy looking fish!  BREWERS? someone needs a Reds cap
nice fish and scenery shots,thanks for sharing
Looks like a good outing, thanks...

Nice job with the photos Bryon.  You guys had a good week.  Wolf Island was good to us also, and some other fishermen wrote me that they hit them hard on Fishgut Rock, Three Sisters and Gull Rock.  So much for my weak moons.  Thanks for the report.  It got me fired up.  I'm heading for the 51st latitude tomorrow morning.  Out of the driveway way before the sun comes up.
nice looking fish what lake were you on and name of lodge thank you
We were on Nungesser Lake about 30 miles north of Red Lake at Anglers Kingdom.
Those are great pictures.  Nice fish too.  Joey
Nice report.  What a nice pike! Your pictures are awesome.  What kind of camera were you using?
The camera is an HP photosmart M525. I think it was only $120.00 or so. It is very easy to use
Great pics and nice report.  That pike is very impressive.  The accomodations look very nice.  Thanks for posting.

Nice fish !!!! great pics too..  ...man that looked like an awesome fishing trip,the cabins look very comfortable,and well the fish pics say it all,that pike was huge.  ..man what a fight that would have been,thanks for sharing....cheers
